summary: This document details an obstruction of justice matter involving Alfredo Rodriguez, who was contacted by attorney Bradley James Edwards regarding documents related to a civil case against Jeffrey Epstein. Rodriguez, a former employee of Epstein, is accused of attempting to sell documents to Edwards that he is legally obligated to provide under a federal subpoena.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez was an employee of Jeffrey Epstein and is involved in an obstruction of justice matter for attempting to sell documents related to the case.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.context: Bradley James Edwards is representing four female individuals suing Jeffrey Epstein and has deposed Rodriguez regarding documents pertinent to the civil case.

connections.description: Rodriguez was an employee of Epstein and is now involved in a legal matter with Edwards, who is representing Epstein's accusers.

events.title: Contact Regarding Documents
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez contacted Bradley James Edwards about documents related to the civil case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: Bradley James Edwards served Alfredo Rodriguez with a federal subpoena to provide documents related to the case.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez is attempting to sell documents related to the civil case against Jeffrey Epstein for $50,000.
Bradley James Edwards is representing four female plaintiffs suing Epstein.
Rodriguez was served with a federal subpoena to provide documents but is refusing to comply without payment.
The document outlines a request to open a new obstruction of justice matter regarding Rodriguez's actions.
